No Poverty.reason: The course discusses economic transitions and development in CEE and Russia but does not explicitly focus on poverty reduction policies.

Zero Hunger.reason: Food security and agricultural issues are not covered in the syllabus.

Good Health and Well-being.reason: Health topics are not addressed; only indirect relevance via socio-economic transitions.

Quality Education.reason: The course promotes knowledge of economic systems, research skills, and critical analysis in a higher education context.

Gender Equality.reason: No content on gender issues or policies affecting equality is included.

Clean Water and Sanitation.reason: Not mentioned or addressed in course content.

Affordable and Clean Energy.reason: Energy systems and sustainable energy are not part of the course focus.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: Core relevance through study of economic transition, market liberalization, privatization, and labor/economic outcomes in post-communist economies.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: Moderately relevant via discussions on market reforms, industrial restructuring, and modernization in CEE and Russia.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: Moderately relevant due to focus on income distribution, social disparities, and policy impacts during economic transitions.

Sustainable Cities and Communities.reason: No explicit content on urban planning or sustainable community development is included.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: Not addressed in the syllabus or course readings.

Climate Action.reason: Environmental and climate issues are not part of the course topics.

Life Below Water.reason: No content related to marine ecosystems or aquatic environmental issues.

Life on Land.reason: Not covered; course focuses on economic and political transitions.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: Some relevance through discussions of governance, institutional reforms, and legal-economic frameworks in post-communist states.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: Minimal relevance; international economic integration (EU membership) is discussed but SDG partnerships are not a focus.
